result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles T Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Restitution of $2,260.00 to Sarah W. for  14CM3617; and $100.00 to Denan W. on this case.  Pay DNA sucharge.
DNA surcharge and restitution to be paid through colelction by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Restitution to be paid first.
No other court costs, are assessed to allow defendant to pay restitution amounts.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA AND SENTENCING commencing AUGUST 31, 2015 received and filed. (85 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to THE INSTITUTION.

Defendant Charles T Schroeder in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Charles T Schroeder in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Rebecca S.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 160  days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain HSED/GED
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment
- No contact with:  Sarah W, Denan W and Liu Y
-  Court orders no other specific programmin conditions.  Defendant must complete a Risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2260.00 to Sarah W on 14CM3617 and $100.00 to Denan W on this case; 
Pay DNA surcharges
No other court costs are assessed to allow defendant to pay restitution amounts
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that DNA surcharge and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Restitution to be paid first.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter dated 7/6/2015 on behalf of the defendant

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Charles T Schroeder not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk Branch 19 is in jury trial on another case.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Charles T Schroeder not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Charles T Schroeder not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Defense no longer wants to proceed with today's scheduled bail/bond hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles T Schroeder in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Charles T Schroeder in custody.  Grant Huebner for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DENAN W., YILIN L., AND THEIR RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Charles T Schroeder in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Charles T Schroeder in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
